review.comment_positive: We loved the location!! Lots of great places to eat within walking distance and away from the overdeveloped Las Vegas karaoke bars near the lake. Staff were very friendly. Breakfast was great and the rooftop was lovely to sit and relax.

review.rating: Quiet and comfortable stay in modern luxury surroundings.
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Executive GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n Ra NÃºi
review.comment_positive:
Quiet room with great Internet as requested. Very large bed with comfortable mattress topper, good AC, and modern lighting and fixtures. View from the balcony was a show stopper, esp in the morning.
Shower water heated up quickly, with good water pressure from the waterfall showerhead. No conditioner provided, but shampoo and soap are there. Other amenities include combs, toothbrushes, shower caps, tea and coffee and a kettle, bottled water, bathrobe.
The hotel itself is located on the edge of the valley, across from Fansipan - great location, close proximity to lots of food and drinks options.
Breakfast service was great - especially loved my beef pho made to order and the coffee service.
Try the 6 floor SkyView terrace at sunset!
review.comment_negative:
I wish the lobby was smoke free. And maybe the front of the hotel. I was trying to get some rest after the overnight train, and I kept waking up because the smoke smell was so strong.
I asked to borrow a shower after being on a plane and then a train for 48 hours, and initially the hotel said yes, they would be able to provide this. But when I arrived to drop bags, they said they couldn't help me. Maybe read the requests more carefully?
Because I was 4th floor and the SkyView terrace was 6th floor, I heard a great deal of karaoke one night. Wish they had a cut off time for noise ordinance, as it was likely disturbing sleep for other guests. The other night, no karaoke.

review.comment_positive: Great location in central Sapa with large room/facilities. The staff we friendly/helpful and accommodating to any needs you might have.

review.rating: AWESOME Stay in Sapa for everyone who likes a fabulous buffet breakfast, shopping, close to sights
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive:
Awesome hotel located within walking distance to Cat2 village, restaurants, shopping and cable car station Sun Plaza. The deluxe room prepared for us with pair of Swans made from towels was a nice gesture to welcome us in the bedroom besides a welcome drink at lobby.. Sleeping on their satin smooth cotton bed linen felt divine incomparable to even 5 star hotel bed linen. 
Their buffet breakfast was AWESOME, love the high quality foods, Intercontinental and local Vietnamese dishes like pho bo, beef stew, fried rice, noodles besides the usual eggs, cheese ham offering. Vietnamese coffee was good too. The variety of freshly cut fruits and delectable desserts served at breakfast was commendable.  Staff service superb as empty plates were quickly cleared from dining table. 

The view of mountains on L6 cafe was awesome for a city location hotel. The bedroom AC was operating well during May month and they even have a stand fan. The bath room shower and bidet worked well with good water pressure.  The bathroom amenities  are superb, complete set of plush white towels changed every day was luxurious service. 

The Wifi strength and stability performed well during my stay in May. The bedroom and hotel area has good coverage, no breakoff of connection , very critical for Guests that need to conduct work or creating content on social media ğŸ˜Š

Highly recommended for your 1 st Sala stay to couples, singles and families and business group.
review.comment_negative: Nothing material.  Noise from immediate neighbour houses, traffic is expected in town center area.  The sounds from neighbouring room may occasionally be heard.

review.comment_positive: I loved everything about the place, it was walking distance to various food outlets, mini marts, coffee shops, souvenir shops, Sapa Station and Sapa Town centre. The room was so comfortable and spacious, the bathrooms clean and the best part were the staff. So hospitable and friendly. My friend and I arrived at 4am and they allowed us to sit in the lobby, use the facilities to freshen up and gave FREE coffee. My package didn't include breakfast but when we checked-in, they gave it to us complementary. The view of the valley was beautiful. I am so happy i stayed there, it was definitely one of the best parts of the trip.

review.comment_positive: The staff were really nice. The hotel was in a good central location. They were able to help us book tours.
review.comment_negative:
This hotel is okay... The style  is very old and outdated . Breakfast is included but it's strange. Seems to be on a token system where the staff say they will give you a token as a kind of good will gesture . I don't understand why it was just not included as all the other hotels we have stayed at in vietnman just have free breakfast included and we don't have to earn tokens at the manager's discretion. 

The first room we stayed in had a really bad smell and there was a problem with the drains..however the staff did allow us to move to a better room once we complained. 

I would suggest you pay extra for a view as our view was the water tanks outside which could be quite loud when they were turned on in the morning.

PhÃ²ng Deluxe NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive:
Their staffs esp the guys at the reception had been very welcoming and helpful whenever we asked for help or information. We arrived very early in the morning and they helped us stored our luggages while we explored Sapa while waiting for check in. 

Rooms and bathroom are very spacious and very clean. Body shampoo, shampoo, razors and even combs are provided. Thx for the free complimentary breakfast! They even provide an extra standing fan in each room. Loved the view at the rooftop sky bar! 

Location wise super strategic and convenient. Only less than 5 mins walk to Sapa train station, good selection of restaurants less than 5 mins away, and about 5 mins walk to main Sapa town. Hotel area is safe to walk late night and not too noisy or busy.
review.comment_negative:
Nothing much to dislike. Everything was good.
We only encountered some issues with the aircond most likely bcoz its manually switched on and off and we most likely did not know how to operate it.

review.comment_positive: beds were clean
review.comment_negative: toilet was not clean, neighbours were extremely loud at 7am in the morning and late at night (they were shouting across rooms). we received a welcome note stating there was breakfast, but later when we called the reception, there is no breakfast served on weekdays. we also called the reception for a taxi to bus station quoting 25k VND, but when we booked the taxi at the reception it became 40k VND. we were also told that drinking water is free but was charged 40K for 2 small bottles in the minibar - when I questioned the staff, they said the water on the table was free but not the ones in the minibar (which did not make sense as they were the exact same bottles). the staff later waived off the cost out of â€œgoodwillâ€ and asked for a 10/10 rating. I also paid premium for a mountain view room but unfortunately there was no view at all - we realised sapa was foggy on all 3 days we were here. overall we felt the stay was not worth it as there were other hotels offering free dinners and laundry service at possibly cheaper price

review.comment_positive:
The staff were excellent and friendly, particularly the manager OK Nguyen who made sure we was happy and looked after. We arrived very early before check-in, the hotel was full so no early check-in available but OK Nguyen provided us with a room to shower and freshen up free of charge, whilst we waited for our rooms to become available.  I booked 3 rooms and for one of the rooms i required a larger room to accommodate 3 persons, OK Nguyen provided a free upgraded suite which was amazing.  

The location is excellent, convenient and within walking distance to everywhere.

The rooms were clean and a very comfortable large double bed.

I fully recommend this hotel, was happy with our stay and would definitely come back.
review.comment_negative: I had booked this hotel especially for the amazing view of Sapa from its rooftop bar, I got no view because the time we spent here the weather was very foggy, you literally cannot see anything but this is not the fault of the hotel.

review.comment_positive: The hotel is nice, located conveniently near the center. The staff were very attentive, helped us with arranging a taxi to the bus station after check-out, and gave advice on places to buy souvenirs. The breakfast is quite diverse and there is a good view from the 6th floor.
review.comment_negative: The pillows weren't very comfortable, nor the mattresses, they felt a bit dated. There was some reddish stains on the sheets, probably from the water, but still not great to see when you lay on them.

review.rating: Many Thanks for the 10 stars hospitality. We'll definitely stay here again!
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Executive GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n Ra NÃºi
review.comment_positive:
Normally we don't review hotel. We just come and go. This is even our first review of a hotel.
Our experience of Sapa Relax hotel is like being a guest of a very close friend that has missed you for a very long time. The staff works beyond extra mile.

We were assisted by Duoc Nguyen (Mr. Ok) beyond the length of his job. He brought us and dine with us were the best & cheap bbq restaurant in Sa Pa. During our conversation we made a comment about the coffee at breakfast, next morning we have our own drip coffee - through the length of our stay he personally serve us drip coffee. On our last day as a breakfast treat we were given a banana pancake - FOC and some souvenirs from the hotel. 

About the rooms, we have no complain - everything is fine.
The mountain view is perfect in this hotel. You just need to hit their 6th floor viewing deck and you will see the grandeur of the mountains of Sa Pa, Vietnam.
review.comment_negative: Well there's only one wish I would want to improve, since we have stayed during the coldest season 13-19 Dec 2022. I wish that they could improve the coffee during morning breakfast, we preferred our coffee to be Piping hot..  It only improve when we were personally serve by Duoc Nguyen (Mr. Ok) every morning with his specially brewed drip coffee... Excellent staff!

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Superior GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n
review.comment_positive: The facilities were clean and well-kept, which was all we needed. For the price of staying in Sapa, hotel and amenities were very affordable and reasonable. The staff was very attentive to our needs. All of them were very polite and had great customer service. Front desk gave us plenty of recommendations in terms of sightseeing, tourism, and food. They helped us book our tickets to Fansipan. Their rooftop deck also has a very great view of the mountains and terrain. Our booking did not include the breakfast buffet, but they provided it for us free of charge so long as we left a review on Booking.com. For the amount of food they had for breakfast, leaving a review was definitely a very fair bargain. Given how much I paid to stay here, would definitely book this hotel again if I ever visit Sapa another time in the future.

review.rating: Double charged me for our stay, book at your own risk!
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Executive GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n Ra NÃºi
review.comment_positive: Location was great and near to Sapa city center, but that was about everything good about this place.
review.comment_negative:
We booked 2 rooms for our party of 4. Hotel was catered to the lower tier mass market as loads of Asean and local tourists being bussed in daily. Morning breakfast was chaotic and food choices was poor. No facilities to speak of, the roof top bar was a rusting platform that looks way better on photos than in real life. We had a much better stay at an earlier guest house with much more personal service.

Hotel deducted the cost for our entire stay twice. I was puzzled when I received 2 notifications from my credit card issuer with the exact amounts being deducted 1 day before our scheduled stay. As we were in the hills trekking, I thought little of the notifications. Upon check-in, I was informed by receptionist that they accidentally double charged me for our 3 night stay for both rooms. Horribly slow follow up and service from the front desk as they said they cannot do the reversal on the same day. It took 3 days from check in to check out before we got some sort of update on the reversal. They had to do a physical run to the bank to get some form of documentation for me written in Vietnamese. It took another 10 days for their bank to resolve this with my credit card issuer. Till now, the issue was only partially resolved as only a partial amount was refunded back to my credit card. Book at your own risk.

review.rating: Wonderful hotel in a stunning location
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Superior GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n
review.comment_positive: The hotel was the nicest and the most comfortable of the 5  hotels we've stayed in on our trip to Vietnam. Really great beds, tastefully decorated rooms, nicely equipped bathrooms, just a general feeling of comfort and ease. The breakfast was varied and good. The staff was really lovely and helpful. Travelling by night train, we arrived to Sa Pa early - they allowed us to leave our luggage at the hotel to go and explore the resort. We returned a few hours before the official check-in and relaxed on the comfortable sofas in the hall with the staff bringing us delicious (and free) cups of tea we hadn't even needed to ask for. As we were waiting, they came to let us know that the family room was ready (a couple of hours before the official check-in time) and in a short while the double rooms were available, too. We had wonderful views from the room but especially from the roof top and the pods were amazing. The hotel arranged for a reasonable taxi service one day and on another day we went on track no 5 - the longest one they organised to remote villages in the mountain. This was an amazing experience for our whole group (9 people of different ages from 13 - 53)

review.rating: They tried, but really could not convince us
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive:
We were suprised how professionel the hotel seemed when we first entered. We even got free breakfast (as the receptionist told us to get better Booking reviews...). After a 2 Day it turned out that they unfortunately are not as professional and good as it seemed first. 
One really nice thing - we forgot our laundry when we departed for our sleeper. As we were really trough from the day we asked the hotel to send our laundry via motortaxi. And it really worked. That was a great help!
review.comment_negative:
Well yeah, for a cheap hotel all of the following points are okayish. But as this one tries to be professional and is not super cheap or anything like that, it was not okay for us.
First, the bathroom was oldish. Renovations were not carried out professionally, and the water came out of the shower everywhere. The ground in the whole room was a little dirty, and especially next to the bad was a set of nail remainings.. additionally, we had stains on our bad sheets that we only noticed in the night. Also, after the second cleaning, none of these points changed. What bothered me the most was an intense smell in the room that was simply nur good.
What was kind of annoying to us was that the receptionists did not speak English well. We tried it a couple of times, but it was so complicated that we just gave up. For example, we tried to book a tour over the hotel. They have a catalog, but when we asked for details and recommendations, he could not help us at all. But as we found an interesting tour in the catalog and it was okay with the price, we wanted to book either way. Even though we knew which tour we wanted very early, we were asked to book it only  in the evening. When we finally wanted to finalize the bookingm the reception told is he gave us the price for a wrong tour and named a much higher price instead. Even though it was already 10 PM and we had trusted him with the initial price, he did not give any discount. Since we were tired and many tour shops already closed, we then booked another tour for the original price. It was nice either way, but very very inconvenient.
Another important information for traveller's may be that we came back on our last day after check out and asked for anywhere to fresh up and relax for the next few ours. They were totally unhelpful and due to the language Barrera we gave up quickly. Gladfilly we found another very cheap hotel who took us for a few hours.
A small addition to the breakfast.

Good selection of breakfast options- particularly the waffle making station and different noodle soups available.

review.comment_negative:
- Noticed our floor was dirty when we checking in ( dust and toe nail), called and cleaner came straight away. Good experience with this!

- Smoking smell in bathroom despite it being non-smoking hotel: Told reception who werenâ€™t very helpful, had to prompt for air freshener and asked for a room change, too which we were told they were fully booked. No one came for a while so we had to reach out again, they said they â€œchecked all the roomsâ€ and that there was no one smoking (basically insinuating we were lying & were very apologetic). Had to complain again before they miraculously found a free room for us to move intoâ€¦ this one also ended up smelling of Tabaco on our last day but we didnâ€™t want the hassle.

Itâ€™s a shame as it tainted our experience at this hotel.

- Hotel cancelled our booking online on our last night (on booking) and essentially stopping us from collecting rewards points and being able to review. Had to get in touch with booking.com to sort this. Another hassle which tainted our experience

-Good facilities, location, breakfast and atmosphere, a more empathetic staff would make this place somewhere I would recommend to stay!

review.rating: Great location, reasonable price, caring staff and management and impeccabily clean
review.room_type: Suite nhiÌ€n ra nuÌi
review.comment_positive: The location of the property was ideal.  Very near everything we wanted in Sapa town but not sitting on top of a noisy bar or along the main road where you'd find traffic noise.  The room we stayed in room 301 was actually bigger than we are used to including a living area a bedroom and a large restroom area.   The breakfast was quite nice and the egg station as well as the made to order Pho was a highlight.  The room had a nice view of the valley and the mountains beyond although to be fair it is not completely unobstructed (It didn't need to be honestly as you could get an unobstructed view easily on the 6th floor skybar.   The staff were very friendly and willing to help.  We arrived before normal check in and they offered to check us in early to a room on the 2nd floor although we opted to wait a little bit for a room on a higher floor.  The bathtub is very spacious and feels luxurious.  It is not, however, a whirlpool bath as there are no jets.   The hotel supplies two bottles of water in the room for free in ecological glass bottles but we really appreciated the water refilling station in the lobby.
review.comment_negative: The Shower is part of the bathtub and you must hold the shower to effectively wash your hair. A simple wall bracket to hold the shower head would make this easier.  We had read other reviews and expected this so we had no problems with it but perhaps in the future the hotel might install a longer hose and a bracket holder to make it a bit easier for guests.  The Hotel is in the middle of the city and as such may be affected by the actions of neighbors. One particularly naughty neighbor decided that raising a rooster in a cage literally outside the window of our bedroom would be a good idea.  We stayed two nights and chose not to complain about the rooster after the first night as we have frequently stayed in places with such noises and figured it was beyond the control of the hotel.   We mentioned it in at checkout and the manager Mr. Ok was quite concerned and very apologetic. He explained that he would buy the rooster from the neighbor so future guests should 1) Not have problems with the rooster and 2) should immediately bring any concerns to the manager Mr. Ok even if you think such things may be beyond the control of the hotel.   Mr. OK and the staff at the hotel are supper willing to do whatever they can to make the stay the best it can be.   Overall, guests should remember that this is a 3 star hotel and our high rating is a result of the value and quality of this 3 star property.  If you come expecting a 5 star experience you likely won't be happy with Sapa Relax Hotel but for a 3 star property this hotel exceeds expectations

review.comment_positive:
The location is located at the center of Sapa. It's very convenience to get a bike rental, good local Sapa restaurants, grocery stores and local massage spa. 

Besides, the hotel has its own rooftop cafe which has a nice view of Sapa, you can see both city and mountain view as the same time. 

In term of facilities, this hotel has its all such as hot water, functional aircondition, useable WiFi and strong internet conditions. Breakfast buffet is good beyond the price. 

Last but not least, hotel staffs have a good service minded, humble and helpful specially thanks to Mr.Sommai Xayyavong for taking care of us and be our translator for our stay. See you next time!!.

review.rating: Let the hotel speak for itself instead of pressuring guests
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Superior GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n
review.comment_positive: The hotel had a good breakfast and was conveniently located. The room size was good.
review.comment_negative:
The room was did not feel very clean. The head board of the bed was fabric/leather and you could see it was covered in dust. 
The room was also quite loud although walking around Sapa I suspect this would be an issue everywhere. Itâ€™s quite a loud little city. 
The main issue we had here was that during our entire stay we were pressured by the hotel to leave a good review. They offered us a room upgrade and breakfast but every time we interacted with the staff they would ask if weâ€™d reviewed the hotel yet. Even one morning we went to get breakfast and before we were allowed they made me pull out my phone to try and review them. It made our stay very uncomfortable and we actually ending up leaving early before our booking ended. We would rather not be given anything free and be able to have a peaceful stay rather than feel all the other reviews were disingenuous and be harassed.

review.comment_positive: The location of the hotel is walkable distance to many shops, massage parlours, restaurants and even Sapa station. review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe Gia Ä‘Ã¬nh
review.comment_positive: We liked that it was centrally located in the middle of town.
review.comment_negative: It was very loud from all the idiot taxis that love to lay on their horns around the clock. There was no Relax at this hotel. Also- it was not clean. There was black mold in the shower and the floors hadnâ€™t been mopped in ages.  When I went to check out the hotel manager told me I needed to pay for a towel that I used as a bath mat. Hilarious because there was no bath mat to keep me from slipping and falling and it was only dirty from the floor in the room. I then told him no, I wouldnâ€™t pay and I proceeded to show him the shower pictures of the mold etc.  He said if I didnâ€™t pay then it would come out of his paycheck. What a racket, and a lie. Well if he was in charge then maybe it should come out of his check for not overseeing the jobs that the housekeepers were doing. He told me if there was a problem with my room not being clean then I should have called the front desk.  At that point I told him I had. Like 9 times and no one would pick up the phone!!!! So this hotel is a joke. The room would be ok if it was clean. But it still would be loud as can be!!!! And the breakfast in the morning is so gross.  You will want to eat elsewhere.  Be prepared.

Weil man das selbst nicht macht, begleitete man uns zum Nachbarhotel Royal, wo die Fahrt gebucht wurde. Schlussendlich waren wir dann Ã¼ber 10 Stunden in einem vÃ¶llig heruntergekommenen Sleeperbus unterwegs, der so Ã¼berfÃ¼llt war, dass alle GÃ¤nge mit Leuten vollgelegt warenn. review.comment_positive: The hotel staff were lovely and helpful with organising taxis. For the price of the hotel, it was an ok experience. I just would like to know about these things if I was to look at staying.
review.comment_negative:
Iâ€™m not one to write a negative review unless I really feel the need to but there was too many less than positive experiences from our hotel stay and I would like others to know. 

Our hotel room wasnâ€™t the cleanest and as soon as my partner sat on the couch for the first time, a big clump of hair got stuck to him. The hotel rooms have a bath but no shower, it does have bath with a hand held shower attachment but as my partner and I are tall, the hose was not long enough to reach our head so we had to crouch down. Just a painful experience when you just want a shower after a long day.

The room service menu is only in Vietnamese and no English option so when I went down to the lobby to order around 2pm, I was told the kitchen only opens at night. 

There is no â€œdo not disturbâ€ or â€œplease clean the roomâ€ sign to put on our door so you get woken up by house keeping coming into the clean your room in the early morning. We told them no and wasnâ€™t a nice way to be woken up. 

The aircon is set to a timer that we canâ€™t change that automatically shuts off after a few hours. I had to get up multiple times in the night to turn it back on. 

The hotel is genuinely quite noisey. With furniture being heard moved all the times above us or the rooster next door or the constant loud parties around us. Wasnâ€™t an overly peaceful place.

review.rating: An enjoyable stay and very helpful staff and good location as it is centrally located.
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive:
I and my daughter stayed here for 2 nights and 3 days and we enjoyed the hotel very much. The location is in central of Sapa and just 5 minutes walk to the ticket office for the cable car to the Fansipan mountain, 5 minutes walk to the Sapa centre, lots of restaurants and clothing stores, shops, coffee shops etc.

The staff were friendly and very helpful and polite, thank you! 

The hotel even provided a pedestal fan which was very helpful if you wanted to use it to dry up some clothes if required.

The price for early December period was also pretty good as it is normally a low key season in Sapa. 

Overall it was a wonderful stay, and considering if the price is right I will come back to this hotel in my next visit to Sapa.
review.comment_negative: The balcony of my room (Deluxe Superior room with city view) was much smaller than I. have expected). No mini bar fridge so we could not store the foods. May be the hotel could consider getting one as users may need to store foods in summer?

review.comment_positive:
We really enjoyed our stay, we were here for 3 nights. Housekeeping did a fantastic job and the room was always kept lovely and clean. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, we have to give a special mention to Mr T on reception who helped us a great deal, free breakfast as we were staying more than 1 night which was very generous. Breakfast was a good buffet selection a mix of Vietnamese and continental with a good choice and very yummy. Mr T booked a cab to take us to a couple of places we wanted to visit in Sapa. We made use of the laundry service which was very quick and efficient. 

The location in Sapa was fantastic, very walkable as close to the main town. 

We also made use of the hotel's spa in town (not the one based within the hotel) we preferred to walk, but Mr T did say we could use a free taxi service provided by the hotel if we wanted to. We thoroughly recommend the Relax spa in town, it is really lovely!! 

We also got a free bag when leaving the hotel which is a really lovely touch and special keepsake for us both.
review.comment_negative: The only reason to deduct a star is the room is a bit dated and tired and not as nice as the photos portray, that being said the room was massive with a nice mountain view from the lounge side (with small  balcony). The corner bath was nice, but not secured to the floor and the safe in our room didn't work, we didn't bring this to the attention of staff as we were not too concerned, however we have no doubt that should we have brought this to their attention it would have been dealt with swiftly.

review.comment_positive:
The staff were very nice, and the check-in process was smooth. 

They were thoughtful and left us a big umbrella in our room to use during our stay. Which came in handy because it was raining a lot while we were there.  

The manager also gave us complimentary breakfast, which was much appreciated as their breakfast buffet was pretty good. It had a decent spread of Western and local food.
review.comment_negative:
The hotel was located next to a school, so it can get a bit noisy with the kids playing and the school bell ringing. 

It didn't help that our room happened to be facing directly at the school, so the noise was very noticeable for us. It was hard to take an afternoon nap. 

But this isn't a problem at night. We slept pretty well through the night, and it helped that the beds were really comfortable.

review.comment_positive: They allowed us to leave our bags at the hotel after we checked out, as we did our 2D1N sapa trek. Also, we were able to shower in the spa toilet after we were back from the trek (but we had to take turns as there was only one toilet). Location was good.
review.comment_negative:
While the FAQ says we can do early check in before 9am by paying 50% of the room charge, it is not guaranteed and is still subject to room availabilities on the day itself. Only got informed on the latter part on the â€˜subject to availabilityâ€™ after we made the booking. Was eventually advised to book one more day to secure the room on the day of early check in (at full cost), which we did and was glad to do so. They also enticed us with free breakfast for good ratings on the app before we even got into our room (but we took it up nonetheless). Not much that I would dispute the rating for :)

Some rooms werenâ€™t very soundproof (according to my friends) but it wasnâ€™t a big deal.

review.comment_positive: Abbiamo soggiornato due notti al Sapa Relax Hotel. Ci sono venuti incontro in modo. Visto che avevamo prenotato due tipologie di stanze diverse ci hanno fatto l'upgrade gratuito alla camera di tipologia migliore. La camera era davvero molto bella e completa di tutto. Ci hanno offerto la colazione per due mattine, una colazione molto buona con ampia scelta sopratutto di salato ma con anche alcune proposte dolci e buonissima frutta fresca. Il personale Ã¨ super gentile e disponibile. Abbiamo anche fatto un massaggio ai piedi di 60 minuti alla SPA e ci Ã¨ piaciuto davvero molto.
